title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 437.5 - Restrictions on use; fees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 437.5 - Restrictions on use; fees

State Regulations
(a) A
municipality may not restrict the use of facilities acquired or developed under
this Part by persons who are not residents of the municipality without the
express approval of the commissioner. (b) Fees. A municipality may charge a
reasonable fee for the use of facilities acquired or developed under this Part. (1)

Fees charged to nonresidents cannot
exceed twice those charged to residents. (2)

Where there is no charge for residents
but a fee is charged to nonresidents, nonresident fees cannot exceed fees
charged for residents at comparable State or local public facilities. (3)

Reservation, membership or annual permit
systems available to residents must also be available to nonresidents, and the
period of availability must be the same for both residents and
nonresidents. (4)

This provision
does not apply to nonresident fishing and hunting license fees. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
437.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
